t: Psalm 25
Of David.
In*pn you, Lord*s my God, I*ld put my trust.
I*pn trust in you; do*ld not let me be put to shame, nor*ld let my enemies triumph over me.
No*ln one who hopes in you will*ld ever be put to shame, but*ln shame will come on those who*ld are treacherous without cause.
Show*pn me your ways, Lord,*s teach*ld me your paths.
Guide*ln me in your truth and teach me, for*ld you are God my Savior, and*ld my hope is in you all day long.
Remember,*ln Lord,*s your great mercy and love, for*ld they are from of old.
Do*ln not remember the sins of my youth and*ld my rebellious ways; according*ln to your love remember me, for*ld you, Lord,*s are good.
Good*pn and upright is the Lord;*s therefore*ld he instructs sinners in his ways.
He*ln guides the humble in what is right and*ld teaches them his way.
All*ln the ways of the Lord*s are loving and faithful toward*ld those who keep the demands of his covenant.
For*ln the sake of your name, Lord,*s forgive*ld my iniquity, though it is great.
Who,*pn then, are those who fear the Lord?*s He*ld will instruct them in the ways they should choose.
They*ln will spend their days in prosperity, and*ld their descendants will inherit the land.
The*ln Lord*s confides in those who fear him; he*ld makes his covenant known to them.
My*ln eyes are ever on the Lord,*s for*ld only he will release my feet from the snare.
Turn*pn to me and be gracious to me, for*ld I am lonely and afflicted.
Relieve*ln the troubles of my heart and*ld free me from my anguish.
Look*ln on my affliction and my distress and*ld take away all my sins.
See*ln how numerous are my enemies and*ld how fiercely they hate me!
Guard*pn my life and rescue me; do*ld not let me be put to shame, for*ld I take refuge in you.
May*ln integrity and uprightness protect me, because*ld my hope, Lord,*s is in you.
Deliver*pn Israel, O God, from*ld all their troubles!
